result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda Lynn Mcgee

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on June 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:42 AM Defendant Amanda Lynn Mcgee appeared in court, Attorney Ann M. Larson for Amanda Lynn Mcgee appeared in court, Attorney Jordan W. Feest for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for April 22, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Scheduling conference on May 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 03-10-22 at 11:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2 cts. felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-07-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is not to possess any syringes and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
